abstract: But the 10 Senate Republicans on the banking committee, seeking to rein in the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, all voted against Richard Cordray's nomination.
snippet: But the 10 Senate Republicans on the banking committee, seeking to rein in the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, all voted against Richard Cordray's nomination.
lead_paragraph: Richard Cordray's bid to lead the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau moved a step forward on Thursday, as a Senate committee approved his nomination along party lines.

headline.main: Nominee to Lead Consumer Agency Clears a Hurdle
